org.gwtwidgets.client.wrap
Class JsGraphicsPanel

java.lang.Object
  com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.UIObject
      com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.Widget
          com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.Panel
              com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.ComplexPanel
                  com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.HTMLPanel
                      org.gwtwidgets.client.wrap.JsGraphicsPanel
All Implemented Interfaces:
com.google.gwt.user.client.EventListener, com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.HasWidgets
public class JsGraphicsPanel
extends com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.HTMLPanel

Wrapper Panel for Walter Zorn's JsGraphics library. To use this wrapper you will need to download the JsGraphics library from http://www.walterzorn.com/jsgraphics/jsgraphics_e.htm. This code was built and tested for JsGraphics version 2.35. To use this panel you will need top include the JsGraphics library in the <head> of the HTMl page. <script src="script/wz_jsgraphics.js" type="text/javascript"></script> You will also need to place a DIV in the HTML page with an ID and must specify the "position:relative" style attribute. If you don't specify this you will find that when you draw shapes, they will be relative to the top-left corner of the page, and not relative to the placement of the DIV. <div style="position:relative;width:350px;height:300px;" id="g"></div> In your code you will create the JsGraphicsPanel, passing the ID of the DIV that will be used as your canvas. You DO NOT need to add this panel to the RootPanel, although there (seems) to be no harm in doing so.
